intro: Sarcocephalus esculentus var. velutina, commonly known as velvet root, is a tropical plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, velvety bark and tuberous roots. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while the flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters. The tuberous roots are the primary edible part, used in traditional medicine and cuisine for their unique flavor and nutritional value.
